intro: Callitriche favargera, commonly known as the favargera water starwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. The plant features slender, branching stems that are often submerged, with small, opposite leaves that are usually less than 1 centimeter in length. It produces tiny, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are pollinated by insects. Callitriche favargera is often found in nutrient-rich waters and can serve as an indicator of water quality.
